name: Saltflats
role_in_state: Primary salt and preserved-goods supplier; low-cost re-export node
economy_niches: tidal-harbor repair and light ship provisioning
culture_adjustments: strong clan-house control of flat leases and labor gangs
seasonal migrant workforce from islander communities accepted as norm
practical, austerely ritualized tide-auguries tuned to mirage and salt-lines
weaker independent guild autonomy; merchant-patron networks dominate local trade
risks: theft of ritual reagents and salted stores
seasonal access cut by extreme tides
constraints: severe freshwater scarcity limits population growth
evaporation industry reliant on imported fuels/reagents
land tenure tied to clan-house patronage restricts outside investment
notes: strategic for state maritime economy despite low settlement density
local tide-charts and auguries essential for safe hauling and drying
